org.openimaj.content.animation.animator

Class FloatArrayValueAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.content.animation.animator.FloatArrayValueAnimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueAnimator<float[]>

    public class FloatArrayValueAnimator
extends Object
implements ValueAnimator<float[]>
    A ValueAnimator capable of producing float arrays from a set of potentially independent underlying ValueAnimators.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      Construct from an array of ValueAnimators

      Construct a new FloatArrayValueAnimator from count LinearFloatValueAnimators with the given start and finish values, and the given duration.

        Construct a new FloatArrayValueAnimator from an array of values using LinearFloatValueAnimators with the range -max to +max and the given duration.
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration of the underlying animators
        maxs - max distance from 0 (+/-)
        Returns:
        new FloatArrayValueAnimator

      • nextValue

        public float[] nextValue()
        Description copied from interface: ValueAnimator
        Get the next value. If the animator has finished, the continuation is checked to see if there are more animators to run. If not, then the last value is returned.
        Specified by:
        nextValue in interface ValueAnimator<float[]>
        Returns:
        the next value.

        public boolean hasFinished()
        Description copied from interface: ValueAnimator
        Has the animator finished animating the value.
        Specified by:
        hasFinished in interface ValueAnimator<float[]>
        Returns:
        true if the animator has finished; false otherwise
